t: A Dirge and a Prayer for Israel, Destroyed by Enemies
O*pn God, the nations have come into Your inheritance; Your*ld holy temple they have defiled; They*ld have laid Jerusalem in heaps.
The*ld dead bodies of Your servants They*ld have given as*i food for the birds of the heavens, The*ld flesh of Your saints to the beasts of the earth.
Their*ld blood they have shed like water all around Jerusalem, And*ld there*i was*i no one to bury them.*i
We*ld have become a reproach to our neighbors, A*ld scorn and derision to those who are around us.
How*ln long, Lord?*s Will*ld You be angry forever? Will*ld Your jealousy burn like fire?
Pour*ld out Your wrath on the nations that do not know You, And*ld on the kingdoms that do not call on Your name.
For*ld they have devoured Jacob, And*ld laid waste his dwelling place.
Oh,*ln do not remember former iniquities against us! Let*ld Your tender mercies come speedily to meet us, For*ld we have been brought very low.
Help*ld us, O God of our salvation, For*ld the glory of Your name; And*ld deliver us, and provide atonement for our sins, For*ld Your name’s sake!
Why*ld should the nations say, “Where*ld is*i their God?” Let*ld there be known among the nations in our sight The*ld avenging of the blood of Your servants which*i has*i been*i shed.
Let*ln the groaning of the prisoner come before You; According*ld to the greatness of Your power Preserve*ld those who are appointed to die;
And*ld return to our neighbors sevenfold into their bosom Their*ld reproach with which they have reproached You, O Lord.
So*ln we, Your people and sheep of Your pasture, Will*ld give You thanks forever; We*ld will show forth Your praise to all generations.
